The personal devices of government officials are a juicy target for hackers. I have a bipartisan bill to protect the phones of Senators and their staff. 

It’s time for Mitch McConnell to put national security ahead of partisan games and bring it to the floor for a vote. https://twitter.com/Reuters/status/1189941383924273152 …

NEWS: @SenatorMenendez and I are demanding answers from the Trump administration about whether the White House is using trade policy as a bargaining chip to get manufactured dirt on Trump's political rivals. https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/10/31/key-senate-democrats-probe-white-houses-handling-ukraine-trade-benefits/ …

Mark Zuckerberg has said he doesn't want the responsibility of blocking false political ads. If that's really the case, and not a desperate attempt to placate the far-right, Facebook should follow Twitter's lead and stop running political ads on its site altogether.
The #SAFEAct contains a mandatory ban on the use of voting machines that are connected to the internet. It's time for the Senate to pass it.

Voting machines that are connected to the internet are ripe for hackers who want to interfere in America’s elections. States are still able to ignore these new federal election security guidelines, leaving the votes of millions of Americans vulnerable. https://www.politico.com/news/2019/10/30/new-voting-machine-rules-061966 …

Congrats to @OregonWBB for entering the season ranked #1 in the @AP_Top25 & to @BeaverWBB for coming in at #7.  Looking forward very much to a great season ahead with two top-10 teams in our state battling for the @pac12 title & @ncaawbb championship. #GoBeavs #GoDucks

Today I’m introducing the PROGRESS Act to close the funding gap for small businesses by creating two tax credits. One to help them hire qualified candidates, and one to help their businesses grow. Read more about my bill: https://www.finance.senate.gov/ranking-members-news/wyden-introduces-bill-to-boost-capital-access-for-women-owned-business …

Women and minority business owners are underestimated, underrepresented, and underfunded. Our tax code doesn't do nearly enough to help women and minority-owned small businesses grow and succeed. pic.twitter.com/zL2WLLoX2J
Today, Senate Republicans will be put on the record about their support for pre-existing conditions. We will see if their actions reflect their promises to the American people. #ProtectOurCare

Trump's approach to health care lets insurance companies sell junk plans that don't cover basic health care and deny coverage to Americans with pre-existing conditions. Now he wants to use taxpayer subsidies to cover this junk.

The ACA includes an provision that I authored, which lets states offer health care that’s better and more affordable. Oregon has taken advantage of the provision to do more with less, lowering premiums for families statewide. Trump wants to turn that idea into a house of horrors.
We made significant progress under the Affordable Care Act in getting all Americans quality, affordable health coverage. https://twitter.com/SenSchumer/status/1189566510701989888 …

We need to hold companies accountable for their profiteering off of consumers. My bill is the way to do it. https://www.wyden.senate.gov/news/press-releases/wyden-introduces-comprehensive-bill-to-secure-americans-personal-information-and-hold-corporations-accountable …

My bill will protect consumers by:

✔️Establishing minimum cybersecurity standards
✔️Creating stiff penalties for companies that misuse or abuse your data (including jail time for execs)
✔️Giving federal regulators the tools they need to go after bad actors abusing your data

It’s time to hold companies and their execs accountable for misusing and abusing consumers’ data.

I just introduced legislation to implement ironclad protections for consumers against these abuses. https://www.theverge.com/2019/10/17/20917988/ron-wyden-facebook-privacy-data-regulation-do-not-track …

Living in today’s information age comes at the expense of the privacy of your personal information.

Everywhere you go, everyone you talk to, every Facebook “like” is collected by companies around the world.
🚨This thread is for anyone who cares about protecting their private information online🚨

Mark Zuckerberg won’t take Americans’ privacy seriously unless he feels personal consequences for lying about his failure to protect your data.

I just introduced a bill that would put execs in jail when they lie to the government about how they protect consumers’ data. https://twitter.com/Gizmodo/status/1184828126259535874 …
